metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3219 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
fish before 2.1.1 allows local users to write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on (1) /tmp/fishd.log.%s, (2) /tmp/.pac-cache.$USER, (3) /tmp/.yum-cache.$USER, or (4) /tmp/.rpm-cache.$USER.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fish - 2.1.1-1
fish-common - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fish package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
